summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JetBlue Airways Corporation on January 23, 2020. It commands JetBlue to produce records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and two other individuals (whose names are not listed in the provided text) for specific time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward) as part of a federal criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking. The document includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration form for a custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and cover letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as an individual for whom JetBlue must provide all passenger, payment, membership, or loyalty records for the periods January 1994 through December 1998 and July 2019 onward.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for JetBlue
events.description: The date by which JetBlue Airways Corporation is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury or produce the requested records to the FBI.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to JetBlue
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to JetBlue Airways Corporation for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and others.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
JetBlue Airways Corporation, 2701 Queens Plaza N., Suite 1, Long Island City, NY 11101

keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to JetBlue Airways on January 23, 2020, seeking travel and payment records for Ghislaine Maxwell and at least two other unnamed individuals.
The subpoena seeks records for two distinct time periods: January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and from July 1, 2019, through the date of service (January 2020).

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that JetBlue voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document indicates an active federal criminal investigation into sex trafficking and related offenses was ongoing in the Southern District of New York as of January 2020.
